metadata.title: CVE-2006-20001 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A carefully crafted If: request header can cause a memory read, or write ofa single zero byte, in a pool (heap) memory location beyond the headervalue sent. This could cause the process to crash. This issue affectsApache HTTP Server 2.4.54 and earlier.

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
